stem: The nurse is caring for a client who is one day post-operative following a lumbar laminectomy. Which of the following nursing actions are essential for this client's care? Select all that apply.

itemContext.sbar: John Smith, 55-year-old male, post-operative day one lumbar laminectomy. Complaining of incisional pain. Vital signs stable. Foley catheter in place. Neurovascular assessment intact.

rationale.correct: Maintaining proper body alignment prevents complications and promotes healing. Logrolling maintains spinal alignment during turning. Assessing lower extremity sensation and movement detects neurological deficits. Administering pain medication promotes comfort and facilitates participation in care. Monitoring for signs of CSF leak allows for early intervention.
rationale.incorrect: Encouraging coughing is contraindicated as it increases intra-abdominal pressure and can disrupt the surgical site. Elevating the head of the bed more than 30 degrees can cause strain on the surgical site.
clinicalPearls: Following a lumbar laminectomy, maintaining spinal alignment is crucial to prevent complications.
Logrolling is a technique used to turn patients while maintaining spinal alignment.
rationale.questionTrap: The question requires the nurse to prioritize actions that directly impact the client's post-operative recovery and neurological status.
rationale.mnemonic: LAMB: Logroll, Assess neuro, Medicate, Body alignment

options.text: Encourage coughing and deep breathing exercises.
Assess lower extremity sensation and movement.
Elevate the head of the bed to 60 degrees.
Monitor for signs of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) leak.
